meanings.definition: A suburban area characterized by monotony and lack of distinct character.
meanings.sent1: The subtopia around here all looks the same.
meanings.sent2: She grew up in a subtopia where every house was identical.
meanings.sent3: In the land of subtopia, even the birds seem bored.
meanings.sent4: The endless rows of houses created a subtopia that felt like a never-ending maze.
meanings.sent5: The subtopia was so dull that even the flowers seemed to sigh in boredom.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being mundane or unremarkable.
meanings.sent1: His life was filled with subtopia, with nothing exciting ever happening.
meanings.sent2: The subtopia of the office made the days drag on endlessly.
meanings.sent3: Even the most thrilling movies couldn't shake off the subtopia of his daily routine.
meanings.sent4: She felt trapped in a subtopia of her own making, longing for something more.
meanings.sent5: The subtopia of the small town was like a blanket of mediocrity that enveloped everything.
